text: Minatsu Murase (born 23 June 1995) is a Swedish ice hockey player currently with HC Örnen in the Hockeyettan, the men's third-tier league in Sweden. == Career == Murase played her first SDHL in 2012, as a 17-year-old with AIK. The following year, she would win the starting job as the club won the SDHL championship.https://www.aftonbladet.se/sportbladet/hockey/a/gPRgx9/minatsu- murase-tror-absolut-vi-kan-ta-guld Murase missed most of 2018–19 season due to pregnancy.https://hockeysverige.se/2018/04/04/os-malvakten-vantar-barn-med- shl-forwarden In the summer of 2019, she would leave AIK to sign with Luleå.https://hockeysverige.se/2019/09/09/de-ar-ligans-basta-malvakter In January 2020, Murase announced that she was leaving Luleå.https://hockeysverige.se/2020/01/17/efter-avskedet-hon-kan-bli-luleas- losning-pa-malvaktssidan After leaving Luleå, Murase would join HC Örnen in the men's Division 3 as they competed for promotion to Division 2.https://hockeysverige.se/2020/02/22/landslagsmalvaktens-comeback-spelade- med-herrar === International === She was named Best Goaltender at the 2013 IIHF World Women's U18 Championship, as Sweden won bronze.http://stats.iihf.com/Hydra/324/IHW324000_85I_1_0.pdf She competed in the 2018 Winter Olympics. == Personal life == She is engaged to New York Rangers' draft pick Robin Kovacs.https://www.svt.se/sport/ishockey/luleaparet ==References== Category:1995 births Category:Living people Category:Ice hockey players at the 2018 Winter Olympics Category:Swedish women's ice hockey goaltenders Category:Olympic ice hockey players of Sweden
title: Minatsu Murase
